content.description:
Can be crowded with top ropers. Some fun climbing which is very close to Toronto. Routes of all difficulties.

A project in 2019 added many sport routes to Rattlesnake Point on both the east and west side. They are documented in the new guidebook "Ontario Climbing: Vol 1.4 Sport Climbing Guide to Rattlesnake Point" by Gus Alexandropoulos and Justin Dwyer.

Access issues:

Rattlesnake Point is the only climbing area managed by Conservation Halton that allows top roping. Do not use the trees as top rope anchors. Bolted anchors are provided.
